title: Bug 21706: BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
description: Bug 21706 reports that BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage.
OB: The bug report lacks sufficient details about the issue's observed behavior.
EB: Add a private constructor to the BidiUtil class. Since there are no non-static methods in this class, adding a private constructor would be a good practice. This prevents unnecessary instantiation of the class. Additionally, it doesn't increase the size, as the compiler provides a free public constructor. The change involves making the constructor private instead of public.
SR: Modify the line above to: static Callback callback = new Callback(new BidiUtil().getClass(), "windowProc", 4); I haven't tested it, but it is expected to achieve the same functionality as before.
